today_in_history_posts.title: MAD-HTLC
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Weak and powerful miners are categorized by their hashrate share related to fees.
- Non-myopic miners forgo immediate fees for better long-term gains, risking a monopoly.
- Myopic miners' success in bribery decreases with time and depends on their hashrate percentage.

today_in_history_posts.title: Disclosure of a fee blackmail attack that can make a victim loose almost all funds of a non Wumbo channel and potential fixes
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A blackmail attack exploiting HTLCs on the Lightning Network was discovered in July 2019.
- Solutions include lowering the max HTLCs and various patches, though challenges remain.
- Suggestions for addressing vulnerabilities include improving disclosure practices in documentation.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scaling involves creating 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for widespread transaction handling.
- These entities will offer liquidity and more affordable transactions, yet maintain blockchain interaction risks.
- Emphasizing security, proposals include using OP_VAULT and protective measures against supply chain attacks.
